author: g11tech
content: shouldn't just calling exchange transition to fetch terminal block good enough? one EL responds `valid` it would have that info (provided EL implemented the fn)

author: ajsutton
content: What do you mean calling exchange transition? The `engine_exchangeTransitionConfigurationV1` call should not return a terminal block hash unless a specific override block was set in the config (even post merge). Otherwise it won't match the CL configuration and will cause warnings to be logged.

author: g11tech
content: ohh i thought that `engine_exchangeTransitionConfigurationV1` would respond with updated info, if not can that change be requested?

author: g11tech
content: although the eth1 merge tracker will do comeup with a terminal block, but lets say a reorg happened/or the first time chain being valid post-merge (here can be indirectly deduced by a `valid` having all `syncing` ancestors in forkchoice), merge tracker should refetch the info i guess to get the latest terminal block.

author: ajsutton
content: That would make it impossible to use `engine_exchangeTransitionConfigurationV1` to actually check the configuration is matching pre-merge because the CL can't tell if the EL has already reached the merge or if it has an incorrect override applied.

author: g11tech
content: i think its easily solvable by extending with a field, `current_terminal_pow_hash` or something like that, but i get your point

author: g11tech
content: also it would make sense for EL to track this info on the current chain head it is considers canonical

author: g11tech
content: but my over all opinion is, do we actually need to make this check in CL on first valids it sees in its forkchoice in a chain (in optimistic sync scenario) assuming that `engine_exchangeTransitionConfigurationV1` has been correctly matched (or matched on fly when the first `valid`s come), because its a bit messy to dupe the check already done by EL
